title: Joshua Chapter 15 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Joshua chapter 15 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Joshua Chapter 15 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Joshua Chapter 15.

questions.question: What was the southernmost border of the tribe of Judah according to Joshua 15:1?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:1 states that the border of Judah extended to the border of Edom, the wilderness of Zin southward, which was the uttermost part of the south coast.

questions.question: According to Joshua 15:5, what formed the east border of Judah?
options: The valley of the son of Hinnom
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:5 clearly states that the east border was the salt sea, even unto the end of Jordan.

questions.question: Who was given the city of Hebron as their inheritance according to Joshua 15:13?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:13 states that Caleb was given the city of Arba, which is Hebron, as part of the inheritance among the children of Judah.

questions.question: Which three sons of Anak did Caleb drive out according to Joshua 15:14?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:14 says Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai.

questions.question: What was the former name of Debir according to Joshua 15:15?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:15 states that Debir was formerly called Kirjathsepher.

questions.question: Who took Kirjathsepher and was given Achsah in marriage according to Joshua 15:17?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:17 states that Othniel, brother of Caleb, took Kirjathsepher and was given Achsah to wife.

questions.question: What did Achsah ask her father for after marrying Othniel, according to Joshua 15:19?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:19 recounts that Achsah asked for springs of water after receiving a south land.

questions.question: According to Joshua 15:12, what formed the west border of the children of Judah?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:12 states that the west border was to the great sea and the coast thereof.

questions.question: Which city is identified as the same as Jerusalem in Joshua 15:8?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:8 states that the border went up to the south side of the Jebusite, which is Jerusalem.

questions.question: Which city was given to Caleb among the children of Judah, as commanded by the LORD to Joshua? (Joshua 15:13)
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:13 specifies Caleb was given Hebron as his inheritance.

questions.question: True or False: According to Joshua 15:63, the children of Judah completely drove out the Jebusites from Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:63 states that the children of Judah could not drive out the Jebusites, who remained in Jerusalem.

questions.question: True or False: According to Joshua 15:11, the border of Judah went out unto the side of Ekron northward.
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:11 confirms the border went out unto the side of Ekron northward.

questions.question: True or False: According to Joshua 15:6, the border went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:6 states the border passed by the north of Betharabah and went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Joshua 15:19: 'Give me a blessing; for thou hast given me a south land; give me also ______.'
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:19 records Achsah asking for springs of water after receiving a south land.

questions.question: Complete the description of the border in Joshua 15:4: 'From thence it passed toward Azmon, and went out unto the river of Egypt; and the goings out of that coast were at the _____.'
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:4 states the goings out of the coast were at the sea.

medium.title: Joshua Chapter 15 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Joshua Chapter 15 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to trust God's provision in difficult circumstances. Based on Joshua 15:13-19, what biblical truth would you share about faith and obedience?
options: Faith leads to receiving God's promises and blessings through obedience
Faith requires doing everything independently without waiting on God
Faith means avoiding challenges to keep life easy
Faith is only about believing without any action
questions.correctAnswer: Faith leads to receiving God's promises and blessings through obedience
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:13-19 shows Caleb obeying God's command and receiving Hebron, and he rewards Othniel with his daughter Achsah. When Achsah asks for springs of water, Caleb blesses her, highlighting that faith and obedience bring God's blessings.

questions.question: How does Joshua 15 teach about perseverance through trials when driving out the inhabitants of the land?
options: Perseverance is needed because some inhabitants, like the Jebusites, remain despite efforts
Giving up quickly when obstacles arise is acceptable
Ignoring God's commands leads to success
Only physical strength matters in overcoming challenges
questions.correctAnswer: Perseverance is needed because some inhabitants, like the Jebusites, remain despite efforts
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:63 states that the children of Judah could not drive out the Jebusites, showing the need for perseverance and trust in God even when victory is incomplete.

questions.question: Which aspect of family life is highlighted in Joshua 15:16-17 about Caleb and Achsah?
options: Marriage as a reward for faith and courage
Marriage based solely on physical attraction
Marriage as a casual agreement without commitment
questions.correctAnswer: Marriage as a reward for faith and courage
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:16-17 shows Caleb promising his daughter Achsah to whoever captures Kirjathsepher, and Othniel taking the city and marrying her, demonstrating marriage as honoring faith and courage.

questions.question: A believer struggles with contentment and gratitude. How does Joshua 15:20 and the surrounding verses teach contentment with God’s provision?
options: The tribe of Judah was given their inheritance according to families, teaching contentment with what God provides
Always desire more than what is given to be successful
Discontentment is a sign of strong faith
God’s provision is only for the wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: The tribe of Judah was given their inheritance according to families, teaching contentment with what God provides
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:20 and verses 1-12 describe the boundaries and allotments given to Judah, showing God’s fair and sufficient provision for His people to be content and grateful.

questions.question: How does Joshua 15:18-19 demonstrate the importance of prayer and asking God for our needs?
options: Achsah asked Caleb for springs of water, showing the value of making requests and seeking blessings
Requests to God are unnecessary if you work hard
It is better to keep silent about your needs
Only leaders should ask for blessings
questions.correctAnswer: Achsah asked Caleb for springs of water, showing the value of making requests and seeking blessings
questions.explanation: In Joshua 15:18-19, Achsah asks her father for water springs after receiving land, illustrating that we should actively seek God’s blessings through prayer and requests.

questions.question: What biblical principle about integrity and honoring commitments can be learned from Joshua 15:16-17?
options: Caleb honored his promise to give his daughter in marriage to whoever captured Kirjathsepher
Promises can be broken if inconvenient
Commitments are optional in God’s eyes
Only verbal agreements without action matter
questions.correctAnswer: Caleb honored his promise to give his daughter in marriage to whoever captured Kirjathsepher
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:16-17 shows Caleb fulfilling his promise to Othniel, demonstrating integrity and faithfulness in keeping commitments.

questions.question: True or False: According to Joshua 15:63, the children of Judah completely drove out the Jebusites from Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:63 explicitly states that the children of Judah could not drive out the Jebusites from Jerusalem, indicating incomplete conquest.

questions.question: When facing challenges in leadership and service, what can we learn from Caleb's example in Joshua 15 about faith and obedience?
options: Faithful obedience to God's commands leads to success and blessing
Leadership is about personal ambition without God’s guidance
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful obedience to God's commands leads to success and blessing
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:13-19 shows Caleb's obedience and faith rewarded with land and family blessings, teaching that God honors those who follow His commands.

questions.question: How does the detailed description of Judah's borders in Joshua 15:1-12 teach about stewardship and responsibility?
options: God entrusts His people with specific responsibilities and boundaries to manage
Boundaries are meaningless and should be ignored
Stewardship is only about financial giving
Only priests are responsible for land management
questions.correctAnswer: God entrusts His people with specific responsibilities and boundaries to manage
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:1-12 describes the precise borders given to Judah, illustrating the principle of stewardship over what God entrusts to us.

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged because some challenges remain unresolved. What encouragement from Joshua 15:63 would you share about perseverance?
options: Some battles take time, and perseverance is needed even when victory is incomplete
If you don’t succeed immediately, give up
God does not care about ongoing struggles
questions.correctAnswer: Some battles take time, and perseverance is needed even when victory is incomplete
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:63 shows that Judah could not drive out the Jebusites, teaching believers to persevere and trust God despite ongoing trials.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Joshua 15 teaches us that God’s provision is _______ and sufficient for His people.
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:1-20 describes the fair allotment of land to the tribe of Judah according to their families, showing God’s just and sufficient provision.

questions.question: What does the story of Achsah asking for springs of water (Joshua 15:18-19) teach us about humility and contentment?
options: It’s appropriate to humbly ask for what you need and be content with God’s blessings
Pride means never asking for help
questions.correctAnswer: It’s appropriate to humbly ask for what you need and be content with God’s blessings
questions.explanation: In Joshua 15:18-19, Achsah humbly asks for water springs after receiving land, showing that humility includes asking for needs and being grateful for God’s provision.

questions.question: True or False: According to Joshua 15:14, Caleb gave up when faced with the sons of Anak in Hebron.
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:14 records that Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak from Hebron, demonstrating courage and perseverance rather than giving up.

questions.question: How can believers apply the detailed city listings in Joshua 15:21-62 to church life and fellowship?
options: The numerous cities show the importance of organized community and fellowship within the body of Christ
Numbers of cities are irrelevant to church life
Only large churches matter to God
questions.correctAnswer: The numerous cities show the importance of organized community and fellowship within the body of Christ
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:21-62 lists many cities and villages, symbolizing the need for believers to live in organized, supportive community and fellowship.

questions.question: What does Joshua 15 teach about humility and trusting God's timing in spiritual battles?
options: Even strong tribes like Judah could not fully conquer Jerusalem immediately, showing the need for humility and trust in God's timing
Trust means forcing results on your own timeline
Spiritual battles are always instantly won
questions.correctAnswer: Even strong tribes like Judah could not fully conquer Jerusalem immediately, showing the need for humility and trust in God's timing
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:63 reveals that the Jebusites remained in Jerusalem, teaching believers humility and patience in God’s timing for victory.

hard.title: Joshua Chapter 15 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Joshua Chapter 15.

questions.question: Which city was given to Caleb the son of Jephunneh as his inheritance according to Joshua 15?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:13 states that Caleb was given the city of Arba, the father of Anak, which is Hebron.

questions.question: What was the original name of the city Debir before it was called Debir?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:15 explains that Debir was formerly known as Kirjathsepher.

questions.question: Who took Kirjathsepher and was given Achsah as a wife?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:17 states that Othniel, Caleb’s nephew, took Kirjathsepher and married Achsah.

questions.question: What did Achsah request from her father Caleb after marrying Othniel?
questions.explanation: In Joshua 15:19, Achsah asks Caleb for springs of water in addition to the south land he gave her.

questions.question: What geographical feature marked the southern boundary of the tribe of Judah's inheritance?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:1 describes the border of Judah going as far as the border of Edom and the wilderness of Zin southward.

questions.question: The eastern border of the tribe of Judah extended to which body of water?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:5 specifies the east border was the Salt Sea extending to the end of the Jordan.

questions.question: What is the significance of the city of Jerusalem in the allotment of Judah according to Joshua 15?
options: The Jebusites were not driven out and dwelt there
It was the capital city given to Caleb
It was the northernmost city of Judah
It was given to the tribe of Benjamin
questions.correctAnswer: The Jebusites were not driven out and dwelt there
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:63 explains that the children of Judah could not drive out the Jebusites who inhabited Jerusalem.

questions.question: Which of the following cities was NOT listed among the southern cities of Judah near Edom?
questions.explanation: Bethel is not listed in the southern cities near Edom; Joshua 15:21-32 lists many cities but Bethel is not among them.

questions.question: What literary device is prominent in the detailed listing of cities and boundaries in Joshua 15?
questions.explanation: The structure of boundary descriptions and city lists in Joshua 15 shows chiastic patterns emphasizing central themes of inheritance and divine promise.

questions.question: The name 'Kirjathjearim' mentioned in Joshua 15 is associated with which other city name?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:9 and 15:60 link Baalah with Kirjathjearim as the same city.

questions.question: The allotment of the tribe of Judah extended westward to which sea?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:12 states the west border was to the Great Sea, which is the Mediterranean Sea.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Judah successfully drove out the Jebusites from Jerusalem according to Joshua 15.
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:63 clearly states the children of Judah could not drive out the Jebusites from Jerusalem.

questions.question: Which river is mentioned as the western limit of Judah’s southern border?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:4 mentions the border going out to the River of Egypt as part of the southern coast boundary.

questions.question: Caleb’s act of driving out the three sons of Anak is an example of which biblical theme?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:14 illustrates Caleb’s faith-driven conquest overcoming giants, a recurrent theme of trust in God leading to victory.

questions.question: Which geographical area mentioned in Joshua 15 is also significant in the wilderness wanderings of Israel in Exodus and Numbers?
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:3 references Kadeshbarnea, a key wilderness location during the Israelites’ journey in Numbers 13-14.

questions.question: The detailed city listings in Joshua 15 serve primarily what purpose within the narrative?
options: To confirm the fulfillment of God’s promise of land to Israel
To provide a census for taxation
questions.correctAnswer: To confirm the fulfillment of God’s promise of land to Israel
questions.explanation: Joshua 15's extensive listing of cities and borders demonstrates the actual division and possession of the land as promised by God to the tribes of Israel.

theological.title: Joshua Chapter 15 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Joshua Chapter 15 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What does the allotment of land to the tribe of Judah in Joshua 15 primarily reveal about God's faithfulness?
options: God fulfills His promises to His people by giving them their inheritance
God leaves His people to struggle for land without guidance
God's promises are conditional and often unfulfilled
God's people must conquer land by their own strength alone
questions.correctAnswer: God fulfills His promises to His people by giving them their inheritance
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:1-12 shows the detailed boundary of Judah's inheritance, demonstrating God's faithfulness in fulfilling the promise to give the land to Israel. This is consistent with God's covenant faithfulness seen in Genesis 12:7, Psalm 105:8-11, Hebrews 6:13-18, and 2 Timothy 2:13.

questions.question: How does the description of Caleb receiving Hebron illustrate the theme of faith and reward in God's kingdom?
options: Caleb's faithfulness leads to receiving a promised inheritance
Caleb's inheritance was based on his military strength alone
Caleb purchased Hebron from the Anakites
Caleb was given Hebron because of his wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Caleb's faithfulness leads to receiving a promised inheritance
questions.explanation: In Joshua 15:13-14, Caleb receives Hebron as a reward for his faith and obedience, reflecting the biblical principle that faithfulness to God results in blessings (Hebrews 11:24-26, Romans 4:20-22, James 2:17, Revelation 2:10).

questions.question: Which theological truth is highlighted by the inability of Judah to drive out the Jebusites from Jerusalem?
options: Human effort alone is insufficient without God's complete empowerment
God abandoned Judah in their conquest
The land was cursed and uninhabitable
The Jebusites were favored by God
questions.correctAnswer: Human effort alone is insufficient without God's complete empowerment
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:63 shows that despite God's promise, Judah could not drive out the Jebusites, emphasizing that spiritual victory requires divine enablement (2 Corinthians 12:9, Ephesians 6:10-12, Philippians 4:13, Romans 8:31).

questions.question: What does the detailed listing of cities and boundaries in Joshua 15 teach about God's nature?
options: God is sovereign and meticulous in His plans for His people
God is indifferent to the details of human affairs
God changes His promises based on circumstances
God leaves His people to define their own destiny
questions.correctAnswer: God is sovereign and meticulous in His plans for His people
questions.explanation: The extensive detail in Joshua 15:21-62 reflects God’s sovereign control and providential care, consistent with His character as a God who ordains history (Psalm 147:4-5, Isaiah 40:12, Proverbs 16:9, Jeremiah 29:11).

questions.question: How does the promise and fulfillment involving Achsah's request for springs of water (Joshua 15:19) reflect God's provision?
options: God provides abundantly to those who seek His blessings
Water was scarce and God did not intervene
The request for water was denied by Caleb
Provision is only for the strong and wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: God provides abundantly to those who seek His blessings
questions.explanation: Achsah's successful request for springs of water (Joshua 15:19) points to God’s generous provision, paralleling Old Testament themes of God as provider (Exodus 17:6, Isaiah 58:11, John 4:14, Philippians 4:19).

questions.question: What doctrinal lesson is conveyed by Caleb's challenge and Othniel's conquest of Kirjathsepher?
options: Faith and courage in God lead to victory and blessing
Conquest is based on luck rather than faith
Promises are only symbolic and not to be taken literally
God rewards only kings and priests
questions.correctAnswer: Faith and courage in God lead to victory and blessing
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:16-17 shows that Othniel’s faith to take Kirjathsepher leads to his reward, illustrating the biblical doctrine that God honors faith and obedience (Joshua 1:7-9, Hebrews 11:30, Psalm 44:3, Romans 8:37).

questions.question: How does the inheritance of Judah's land illustrate God's covenantal faithfulness throughout redemptive history?
options: God’s covenant promises are enduring and fulfilled in history
Land inheritance is unrelated to God’s promises
God’s promises are conditional on human perfection
questions.correctAnswer: God’s covenant promises are enduring and fulfilled in history
questions.explanation: The allotment to Judah in Joshua 15 reflects the fulfillment of God’s covenant to Abraham (Genesis 15:18-21, Deuteronomy 7:9, Psalm 89:34-37, Luke 1:72-73).

questions.question: What eschatological significance can be drawn from the tribe of Judah's inheritance described in Joshua 15?
options: Judah’s land points forward to the eternal kingdom of the Messiah
The land is only an earthly possession with no spiritual meaning
The inheritance was temporary and forgotten
The land belongs to the people regardless of God’s promise
questions.correctAnswer: Judah’s land points forward to the eternal kingdom of the Messiah
questions.explanation: Judah’s prominent inheritance (Joshua 15) foreshadows the Messianic kingdom from Judah’s line (Genesis 49:10, Isaiah 9:7, Luke 3:33, Revelation 5:5), connecting the earthly allotment to God’s eternal plan.

questions.question: What does the inclusion of detailed city names and borders teach about the nature of God's kingdom and order?
options: God’s kingdom is ordered, precise, and established on His promises
God’s kingdom is chaotic and unstructured
God shows partiality by ignoring minor tribes
God’s kingdom is only spiritual with no earthly order
questions.correctAnswer: God’s kingdom is ordered, precise, and established on His promises
questions.explanation: The comprehensive listing of cities and borders (Joshua 15:21-62) indicates God's ordered governance, reflecting biblical principles of divine order (1 Corinthians 14:40, Colossians 1:16-17, Psalm 104:24, Jeremiah 31:33).

questions.question: How does Joshua 15 reveal the relationship between divine sovereignty and human responsibility?
options: God sovereignly grants the land, but Israel must exercise faith and obedience to possess it
God forces possession without human effort
Human effort alone secures inheritance without God’s help
questions.correctAnswer: God sovereignly grants the land, but Israel must exercise faith and obedience to possess it
questions.explanation: The chapter shows that God assigns the land (Joshua 15:1-12), yet individuals like Caleb and Othniel must act in faith to take possession (Joshua 15:13-17), consistent with biblical teaching on faith and works (Philippians 2:12-13, James 2:14-26, Deuteronomy 11:8-12).

questions.question: How does the persistence of the Jebusites in Jerusalem relate to the concept of spiritual incompleteness before Christ?
options: It symbolizes the incomplete conquest of sin before Christ’s reign
It shows God’s failure to protect his people
It indicates complete defeat and loss of faith
It means Jerusalem was cursed permanently
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes the incomplete conquest of sin before Christ’s reign
questions.explanation: Joshua 15:63 reveals that Judah could not drive out the Jebusites, symbolizing the ongoing struggle with sin and the need for Christ’s perfect conquest (Romans 7:18-25, Colossians 2:15, Hebrews 9:26, Revelation 20:10).

questions.question: Which attribute of God is demonstrated by the specific allotment of land boundaries to Judah?
questions.explanation: Assigning precise land boundaries (Joshua 15:1-12) shows God's just distribution of blessings and His faithfulness to promises, paralleling Deuteronomy 32:4, Psalm 89:14, Lamentations 3:22-23, and Hebrews 10:23.

questions.question: How does Caleb’s reward of Hebron and the land with springs of water demonstrate aspects of God’s covenant blessings?
options: Blessings include provision, security, and family
Blessings are limited to spiritual gifts only
Blessings are symbolic without real substance
Blessings depend on human merit alone
questions.correctAnswer: Blessings include provision, security, and family
questions.explanation: Caleb’s receipt of Hebron and water springs (Joshua 15:13-19) illustrates covenant blessings that encompass material provision, land security, and family (Deuteronomy 28:1-14, Psalm 23:1-3, Ezekiel 36:29-30, Matthew 6:33).

questions.question: What Christological significance can be inferred from the tribe of Judah's inheritance and leadership prominence?
options: Judah’s leadership foreshadows Christ, the Lion of Judah
Judah’s inheritance is unrelated to Christ
Christ came from a different tribe
Judah’s role diminishes in New Testament theology
questions.correctAnswer: Judah’s leadership foreshadows Christ, the Lion of Judah
questions.explanation: Judah’s preeminent inheritance (Joshua 15) prefigures Christ’s messianic role as the Lion of Judah (Genesis 49:9-10, Revelation 5:5, Hebrews 7:14, John 1:49).

questions.question: What does the extensive naming of cities and villages in Joshua 15 suggest about the nature of the people’s relationship to their land?
options: The people’s identity is closely tied to their land as God’s gift
The land is unimportant to the people’s identity
The land is considered a burden and curse
The land is owned solely by human effort
questions.correctAnswer: The people’s identity is closely tied to their land as God’s gift
questions.explanation: The detailed enumeration of cities (Joshua 15:21-62) signifies the integral relationship between the people and the land granted by God, consistent with biblical themes of inheritance and identity (Leviticus 25:23, Psalm 16:5, Acts 7:5, Hebrews 11:9).
